com.ibm.team.scm.client
Interface IFlowNodeConnection

All Superinterfaces:
IConnection, IEventSource
All Known Subinterfaces:
IWorkspaceConnection
public interface IFlowNodeConnection
extends IConnection

Interface for allowing a client to carry on an extended interaction with a flow node (workspace or stream) stored in a repository.

Flow node connections are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on IFlowNodeConnection can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

Design discussion: Unlike other auditable items, clients will generally have a protracted engagement with a workspace: accessing files and other versionable items, creating, modifying, and deleting then under the umbrella of an active change set, and periodically accepting from and delivering to another workspace or stream. In this normal usage profile, a workspace is only being modified by a single contributor. Indeed, it would be rare for another contributor to have anything other than a passing interest in another contributor's workspace. Workspaces serve a second role in the implementation, namely as a team workspace or stream. For that the usage profile is completely different. The stream is consulted from time to time by contributors working in child workspaces. Occasionally they will accept/deliver changes from/to another workspace or stream, but those are point events. In other words, the profile of a stream is one of sporadic shared access by a group of users. The profile of a contributor workspace is one of sustained exclusive access by a single user. The fact that from time to time a contributor might need to work directly in a stream does not alter the fact that there are two distinct workspace usage profiles. Both need to be supported well by the client API.

The "resolved" workspace (auditable item will full state can always be retrieved. @see #getResolvedWorkspace().

The operations that are common to both workspaces and streams are supplied in this interface; the operations that are specific to workspaces only are supplied in IWorkspaceConnection.

Even with this split, for the workspace usage profile, we want to make the information maximally convenient for a client to work effectively. Since it is not a shared resource, there is no problem caching information client side. Nothing about the workspace changes except by that client's own actions. The client may be multi-faceted and modular (as opposed to monolithic). It will be maximally convenient for the client if the IWorkspaceConnection serves as the focal point for the client's activities. Conclusion: IWorkspaceConnection should behave like the Eclipse Platform's IResource handles; IWorkspaceConnection is a lightweight handle; there is a client-side handle factory so that any part of the client has a standard way to get hold of an IWorkspaceConnection handle for the workspace they want to work with; the system maintains an internal table (local to the ITeamRepository instance) of sessions talking to particular workspaces in the repository; all client calls to the methods on the handle are forwarded to the appropriate session already in progress (or a new session if the first time); all clients are see the same information cached client side; all clients are perfectly up to the moment with the workspace they're using.

For the stream usage profile, the client is not typically accessing the stream directly. It's mainly when they re-sync their workspace with the current state of the parent stream, and accept or deliver changes. Using the same approach is fine; it's just that the client-side picture of streams is almost always stale because they are being updated in the repository by other clients.

Each flow node connection is permanently associated with a single repository ( {@link #teamRepository()}). A flow node connection is valid and usable while the repository is logged in to. If the repository is logged into again, it will be again possible to use these flow node connections.

Since:
0.5

BASELINE_SETS

static final java.lang.String BASELINE_SETS
The IFlowNodeConnection.getBaselineSets(IProgressMonitor) property. Limitation: Events are only sent regarding local changes to the baseline set list. Since this list can grow arbitrarily long and change from multiple clients, these property change events are not sent out on workspace #refresh(IProgressMonitor).

getDescription

Returns the description.

Returns:
the description; may be null

getOwner

IAuditableHandle getOwner()
Returns the auditable item that owns the flow node. Supported owners include teams ITeamAreaHandle or contributors IContributorHandle.

Returns:
the owner.

getVTime

ISyncTime getVTime()
Returns the virtual time of the flow node.

The flow node vtime represents the state of the flow node at a particular point in time. It is updated whenever the flow node is modified in a way that is intrinsic to the node itself. Workspace vtime gets updated when:

  • components are added or dropped from the workspace
  • workspace intrinsic properties (owner, name, description, etc.) change in any way
The vtime is used for detecting cases where the client has become out of sync with the flow node on the server when it is concurrently modified by another party.

The vtime is current as of the most recent successful @LongOp call that modifies the vtime.

Returns:
the flow node's last-known vtime

isStream

boolean isStream()
Returns if this flow node represents a stream.

Returns:
true if it is a stream, false if it is a workspace.

equals

boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
Returns whether this flow node connection is the same as the given object. Returns true if only if the given object is a flow node connection for the same repository and workspace or stream. Same repository means identical IConnection.teamRepository(); same workspace/stream means same IItemHandle.sameItemId(IItemHandle).

changeHistory

IChangeHistory changeHistory(IComponentHandle component)
                             throws ItemNotFoundException,
                                    ComponentNotInWorkspaceException
Returns the change history for the given component known to this flow node.

The returned change history is live in the sense that subsequent changes to the flow node affecting that component will automatically become visible (i.e., a newly-created change set will appear near the end of the list returned by IChangeHistory#recent()).

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
  • The given component is known to this flow node.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the handle of the component of interest; must not be null
Returns:
the live flow node change history for the given component; never null
Throws:
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace

getComponents

java.util.List getComponents()
                             throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the list of components known to this flow node and accessible to the logged in user.

Note that the list of component is cached client side, as well as being maintained persistently with the flow node. For a connection that is used frequently, the list is always current; if you require this value to be accurate, call #refresh() beforehand.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Returns:
a possibly empty list of component (element type: IComponentHandle); unmodifiable and fixed; the component are in unspecified order which may vary from call to call; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
#addComponent(IComponentHandle), #addComponent(IComponentHandle, IBaselineConnection), #dropComponent(IComponentHandle), IFlowNodeConnection.replaceComponent(IComponentHandle, IConnection, boolean, IProgressMonitor), IFlowNodeConnection.replaceComponent(IComponentHandle, IConnection, boolean, boolean, IProgressMonitor), IFlowNodeConnection.replaceComponents(List, List, List, IProgressMonitor), IFlowNodeConnection.replaceComponents(List, List, List, boolean, IProgressMonitor), IFlowNodeConnection.applyComponentOperations(List, IProgressMonitor), IFlowNodeConnection.applyComponentOperations(List, boolean, IProgressMonitor)

getUnreadableComponents

java.util.Collection getUnreadableComponents()
                                             throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the list of components known to this flow node, but inaccessible to the logged in contributor. These components can only be dropped from the workspace, and are listed here to assist in cleanup.

Note that the list of unreadable components is cached client side, as well as being maintained persistently with the flow node. For a connection that is used frequently, the list is always current; if you require this value to be accurate, call #refresh() beforehand.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Returns:
a possibly empty list of component (element type: IComponentHandle); unmodifiable and fixed; the component are in unspecified order which may vary from call to call; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

configuration

IConfiguration configuration(IComponentHandle component)
                             throws ItemNotFoundException,
                                    ComponentNotInWorkspaceException
Returns the configuration for the given component known to this flow node.

The configuration is "live" in the sense that subsequent changes to the flow node will automatically be visible (i.e., a newly-created file can be located within the returned configuration using IConfiguration#locateAncestors(List)).

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
  • The given component is known to this flow node.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the component; must not be null
Returns:
the live current flow node's configuration; never null
Throws:
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace

setOwner

void setOwner(IAuditableHandle owner,
              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
              throws TeamRepositoryException
Sets the flow node's owner. If this is a stream then the owner must be a IProcessAreaHandle and in the same project that is was created in. If this a workspace, then the owner must be a IContributorHandle.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
owner - the owner; must not be null, must be either a IContributorHandle or ITeamAreaHandle.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Throws:
PropertyConstraintException - if the supplied properties violate a constraint of the item being updated
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

addComponent

IUpdateReport addComponent(IComponentHandle component,
                           IBaselineConnection baseline,
                           boolean produceDetailedUpdates,
                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. please use applyComponentOperations for continued support

Adds the given component to this flow node and initializes the change history and configuration for that component to be the same as the given baseline's. This baseline shall be also be recorded as being the most recent basis for the component within this flow node.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
  • The given component is not known to this flow node.
  • The given baseline is for the given component.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the component to add to this flow node; must not be null
baseline - the baseline from which to obtain the initial configuration and change history; must not be null
produceDetailedUpdates - true if the client requires detailed item update reports for this component operation, false otherwise. if false, these item reports will not be calculated.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
The update report noting the change in flow node configuration. Each IItemUpdateReport returned from IUpdateReport.updates() describes the versionable added from the baseline's configuration, as retrieved via IItemBaseReport.item(). IItemUpdateReport.getNewCurrentState() will evaluate to the versionable state added while IItemUpdateReport.getPreviousState() evaluates to null.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

addComponent

IUpdateReport addComponent(IComponentHandle component,
                           IFlowNodeConnection flowNode,
                           boolean produceDetailedUpdates,
                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. please use applyComponentOperations for continued support

Adds the given component to this flow node and initializes the change history and configuration for that component to be the same as the given flow node's.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
  • The given component is not known to this flow node.
  • The given component is known to the other flow node.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the component to add to this flow node; must not be null
flowNode - the flow node from which to obtain the initial configuration and change history of the component; must not be null.
produceDetailedUpdates - true if the client requires detailed item update reports for this component operation, false otherwise. if false, these item reports will not be calculated.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
The update report noting the change in flow node configuration. Each IItemUpdateReport returned from IUpdateReport.updates() describes the versionable added from the baseline's configuration, as retrieved via IItemBaseReport.item(). IItemUpdateReport.getNewCurrentState() will evaluate to the versionable state added while IItemUpdateReport.getPreviousState() evaluates to null.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

addComponent

IUpdateReport addComponent(IComponentHandle component,
                           boolean produceDetailedUpdates,
                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. please use applyComponentOperations for continued support

Adds the given component to this flow node and starts a new change history for that component. The initial configuration of the component consists entirely of the component's root folder. The component in this flow node's basis is set to the component's initial baseline (@link IComponent.getInitialBaseline().

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
  • The given component must not be known to this flow node.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the component to add to this flow node; must not be null
produceDetailedUpdates - true if the client requires detailed item update reports for this component operation, false otherwise. if false, these item reports will not be calculated.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
The update report noting the change in flow node configuration. In this case, a single versionable is added - the root of component - as noted by the single IItemUpdateReport returned by IUpdateReport.updates(). IItemUpdateReport.getNewCurrentState() evaluates to the state of the folder added., while IItemUpdateReport.getPreviousState() evaluates null.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
#dropComponent(IComponentHandle)

replaceComponent

IUpdateReport replaceComponent(IComponentHandle component,
                               IConnection seedConnection,
                               boolean produceDetailedUpdates,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. please use applyComponentOperations for continued support

Equivalent to replaceComponent(component, seedConnection, produceDetailedUpdates, false, monitor);

Throws:
TeamRepositoryException

replaceComponent

IUpdateReport replaceComponent(IComponentHandle component,
                               IConnection seedConnection,
                               boolean produceDetailedUpdates,
                               boolean force,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. please use applyComponentOperations for continued support

Replaces a component in this flow node and initializes the change history and configuration for that component to be the same as the given baseline or flow node connection's.

If the seed connection is a baseline connection, then this baseline shall be recorded as being the most recent basis of the component within this flow object.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
  • The given component is known to this flow node.
  • The given component is known/associated to the other connection.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the component to re-seed within this flow node; must not be null
seedConnection - the connection from which to obtain the new configuration and change history of the component; must not be null. If the connection is that of a flow node, the flow node cannot contain conflicts and its component/changeHistory cannot reference any active changesets.
produceDetailedUpdates - true if the client requires detailed item update reports for this component operation, false otherwise. if false, these item reports will not be calculated.
force - Will force replacing the component even if there are active changesets or conflicts which prevent the creation of a baseline.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
The update report noting the change in workspace configuration, if the flow node is a workspace; empty if the flow node is a stream (since there is no file area to update). Each IItemUpdateReport returned from IUpdateReport.updates() describes the versionable added from the seed connection's configuration, as retrieved via IItemBaseReport.item(). IItemUpdateReport.getNewCurrentState() will evaluate to the versionable state added while IItemUpdateReport.getPreviousState() evaluates to null.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace
ActiveChangeSetsException - if force is false and there are active changesets in a component to be replaced
ConflictsProhibitOperationException - if force is false and a component to be replaced has conflicts.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

replaceComponents

IUpdateReport replaceComponents(java.util.List components,
                                java.util.List seedConnections,
                                java.util.List produceDetailedUpdates,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. please use applyComponentOperations for continued support

Equivalent to replaceComponents(components, seedConnections, produceDetailedUpdates, false, monitor);

Throws:
TeamRepositoryException

replaceComponents

IUpdateReport replaceComponents(java.util.List components,
                                java.util.List seedConnections,
                                java.util.List produceDetailedUpdates,
                                boolean force,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. please use applyComponentOperations for continued support

Replaces components in this flow node and initializes the change history and configuration for that component to be the same as the given baseline or flow node connections.

If any of the seed connections are baseline connections, then this baseline shall be recorded as being the most recent basis for the indicated component within this flow node.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
  • The given components are known to this flow node.
  • The given components are known/associated to the corresponding connection.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
components - list (element type: IComponentHandle) of the components to add to this flow node; must not be null.
seedConnections - list (element type: IConnection) of the connections from which to obtain the initial configuration and change history of the component; must not be null. The flow node cannot contain conflicts, and its component/changeHistory cannot reference any active changesets.
produceDetailedUpdates - a parallel list of booleans describing for each component whether or not to produce detailed item update reports. true if the client requires detailed item update reports for this component operation, false otherwise. if false, these item reports will not be calculated.
force - Will force replacing the component even if there are active changesets or conflicts which prevent the creation of a baseline.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
The update report noting the change in workspace configuration, if the flow node is a workspace; empty if the flow node is a stream (since there is no file area to update). Each IItemUpdateReport returned from IUpdateReport.updates() describes the versionable added from the seed connection's configuration, as retrieved via IItemBaseReport.item(). IItemUpdateReport.getNewCurrentState() will evaluate to the versionable state added while IItemUpdateReport.getPreviousState() evaluates to null.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because any of the specified components are not in the workspace
ActiveChangeSetsException - if force is false and there are active changesets in a component to be replaced
ConflictsProhibitOperationException - if force is false and a component to be replaced has conflicts.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

dropComponent

IUpdateReport dropComponent(IComponentHandle component,
                            boolean produceDetailedUpdates,
                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                            throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. please use applyComponentOperations for continued support

Removes the given component from this flow node. Dropping a component from a flow node also removes any active change sets (and associated conflict reports) for that component. The returned update report notes what versionables were dropped from the flow node.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
  • The given component is known to this flow node.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the component to remove from this flow node; must not be null
produceDetailedUpdates - true if the client requires detailed item update reports for this component operation, false otherwise. if false, these item reports will not be calculated.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
The update report noting the change in flow node configuration. Each IItemUpdateReport returned from IUpdateReport.updates() describes the versionable dropped from the configuration, as retrieved via IItemBaseReport.item(). IItemUpdateReport.getNewCurrentState() will evaluate to null and IItemUpdateReport.getPreviousState() evaluates to the state being dropped.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository, or the component does not exist in the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
#addComponent(IComponentHandle)

compareTo

IChangeHistorySyncReport compareTo(IFlowNodeConnection remoteFlowNode,
                                   int flags,
                                   java.util.List excludedComponents,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
Compares the change histories of this flow node to the given flow object and returns a report describing their relative synchronization.

Active change sets are included even through incoming active change sets are never eligible to be accepted.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client is logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met. Operations on the resulting report do not use the connections or contact the server.

Parameters:
remoteFlowNode - the other flow node to compare this one to; must not be null
int - includeBaselineInfo a bitmask of the different values defined in WorkspaceComparisonFlags for WorkspaceComparisonFlags.CHANGE_SET_COMPARISON_ONLY, the returned report contains only the lists of incoming and outgoing change sets; for WorkspaceComparisonFlags.INCLUDE_BASELINE_INFO, the returned report additional contains the lists of incoming and outgoing baselines and the lists of just the incoming and outgoing change sets that are after the last incoming or outgoing baseline. if the mask includes WorkspaceComparisonFlags.INCLUDE_EMPTY_BASELINES, then the compare report will include baselines which are empty wrt their predecessor as well as baselines for which there are no incoming or outgoing changes corresponding for. if the mask includes WorkspaceComparisonFlags.INCLUDE_REPLACED_COMPONENT_INFO, then the compare report will include information on components that were replaced in remoteFlowNode.
excludedComponents - the possibly empty list of components (element type: IComponentHandle) to exclude from mention in the report; must not be null. It is fine if some of the components are not known to either flow node.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a report describing the relative synchronization of the flow object with the given flow node; never null;
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

compareToBaseline

IChangeHistorySyncReport compareToBaseline(IBaselineHandle baseline,
                                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                           throws TeamRepositoryException
Compares the workspace with a particular baseline.

Parameters:
baseline - the baseline (and component) to compare to; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a report describing the relative contents of a component in the workspace and the given baseline; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

getBaselinesInHistory

IHistoricBaselineIterator getBaselinesInHistory(IComponentHandle component,
                                                int max,
                                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves an iterator to access the baselines in this flow node for a particular component (including the current basis). Baselines are considered to be part of this workspace's history if this workspace's change history is built explicitly on top of previous baselines. In the very least, this result should include the component's initial baseline.

Parameters:
component - the component for which to get the baselines; cannot be null; must be known to this flow node.
max - the maximum number of results to return. The server can choose to return a smaller number for whatever reason.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a historic baseline iterator; never null;
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace
ItemNotFoundException - if the flow node connection has been deleted, or if the component does not exist in the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
for retrieving the current basis.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client must be logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

getMergedBaselineHistory

IHistoricBaselineIterator getMergedBaselineHistory(IComponentHandle component,
                                                   int max,
                                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the list of baselines in this flow node for a particular component (including the current basis) merged with the list of past bases. Note that baselines may appear in the list more than once, either because they appear multiple times in the basis history, or because they appear in both the baseline history and the basis history. For example the current basis will always appear twice due to the above property.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client must be logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the component for which to get the baselines; cannot be null; must be known to this flow node.
max - the maximum number of results to return in the first request. The server can choose to return a smaller number for whatever reason. For access to more results call IHistoricBaselineIterator.getPrevious(int, IProgressMonitor) with another max size value.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a historic baseline iterator; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace
ItemNotFoundException - if the flow node connection has been deleted, or if the component does not exist in the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

getBaselineSets

java.util.List getBaselineSets(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the list of baseline sets created or associated with this workspace or stream. The items in the list not specified to be in any particular order.

Parameters:
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the list (possibly empty) of baseline sets captured from this workspace or stream (element type: IBaselineSetHandle); the list is immutable; never null
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException

cloneRemoteBaselineSet

IBaselineSetHandle cloneRemoteBaselineSet(IBaselineSetHandle toClone,
                                          ITeamRepository fromRepository,
                                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
This method allows for a baseline set to be "cloned" across different repositories. The new baseline set will have a different item id and will be otherwise equivalent to the baseline set in the source repository. The new baseline set will be associated with the underlying workspace for this flow connection.

Parameters:
toClone - - the baseline set to clone, cannot be null, must exist in fromRepository
fromRepository - - the repository which contains the source baseline set. Cannot be the same repository as the one which contains this workspace.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a baseline set handle, never null
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException
Since:
0.8

                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                    throws TeamRepositoryException

Throws:

getFlowTable

IFlowTable getFlowTable()
Returns the flow table for this flow node. The flow table returned is not modifiable; use IFlowTable.getWorkingCopy() to obtain a copy that can be modified.

Note that the flow table is always available client side, as well as being maintained persistently with the flow node. The flow table is considered as owned by the flow node; the access rights to modify the flow table are dictated by the client's access rights to the owning flow node.

Returns:
the flow node's flow table; never null

setFlowTable

void setFlowTable(IFlowTable flowTable,
                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Sets the flow table for this flow node.

Note that the flow table is persisted in the repository immediately and associated with the flow node.

The flow table returned by IFlowNodeConnection.getFlowTable() is not modifiable. Use IFlowTable.getWorkingCopy() to obtain a copy that can be modified.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client must be logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Throws:
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

getComponentAuditTrail

java.util.List getComponentAuditTrail(IComponentHandle component,
                                      long start,
                                      long max,
                                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the audit trail of the specified component starting with the entry at the given index and returns max number of entries. The entries are numbered starting at 0 for the earliest and ascending for later entries.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client must be logged in to the repository.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

Parameters:
component - the component to retrieve the audit trail for
start - the first entry to retrieve.
max - the maximum number of entries to retrieve
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a list (element type: IComponentInfo) ordered from earliest to latest; never null;
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the flow node connection has been deleted, or if the component does not exist in the repository
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

componentOpFactory

IFlowNodeConnection.IComponentOpFactory componentOpFactory()
Returns the factory for creating component operations.

Note that neither the factory nor the configuration operation object they create are specific to this repository or workspace connection; one factory is as good as any other.

The repository need not be logged in.

Returns:
a component operation factory; never null
See Also:
IFlowNodeConnection.applyComponentOperations(List, IProgressMonitor)

applyComponentOperations

IUpdateReport applyComponentOperations(java.util.List ops,
                                       boolean forceReplace,
                                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
Atomically modifies the set of components associated with this workspace.

Parameters:
ops - List of IFlowNodeConnection.IComponentOp objects to be performed; must not be null or have a single component involved in more than 1 operation.
force - Will force replacing the component even if there are active changesets or conflicts which prevent the creation of a baseline.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
The update report noting the changes in flow node configuration; can be null in the case of a process error. Each IItemUpdateReport returned from IUpdateReport.updates() describes the versionable modified in the configuration.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection, or if any of the components are specified to be available in the repository and are not.
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because a component specified to be removed or replaced is not in the workspace
ActiveChangeSetsException - if force is false and there are active changesets in a component to be replaced
ConflictsProhibitOperationException - if force is false and a component to be replaced has conflicts.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
IFlowNodeConnection.componentOpFactory()

IUpdateReport applyComponentOperations(java.util.List ops,
                                       boolean forceReplace,
                                       ISynchronizationInfo time,
                                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
Atomically modifies the set of components associated with this workspace.

Parameters:
ops - List of IFlowNodeConnection.IComponentOp objects to be performed; must not be null or have a single component involved in more than 1 operation.
force - Will force replacing the component even if there are active changesets or conflicts which prevent the creation of a baseline.
time - - the synchronization times, or null if no synchronization info is required
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
The update report noting the changes in flow node configuration; can be null in the case of a process error. Each IItemUpdateReport returned from IUpdateReport.updates() describes the versionable modified in the configuration.
Throws:

java.util.List getComponentsContainingVersionable(IVersionableHandle versionableHandle,
                                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the components whose current configuration contains the versionable item identified.

If the client is not logged in to the repository, the operation throws NotLoggedInException.

Parameters:

monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the list of components (element type: IComponentHandle in this flow node whose current configuration contains the versionable identified; never null If the versionable does not exist in any of the components, then the list will be empty.

ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection

compareConfigurations

IUpdateReport compareConfigurations(IFlowNodeConnection otherConnection,
                                    java.util.List componentsToConsider,
                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns an update report which represents the delta between the current workspace's configuration and the supplied other flow node's configurations. This operation is read-only and does not alter the workspace in any way.

Parameters:
otherConnection - the other flow node connection, cannot be null
componentsToConsider - the client can supply null to indicate that they want to compare all components common to both workspaces, or a non-empty list of components to consider (the list cannot contain nulls.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
an update report, never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under either IWorkspaceConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

findChangeSetsInFlows

java.util.Collection findChangeSetsInFlows(java.util.Collection changeSets,
                                           int flowFlags,
                                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                           throws TeamRepositoryException
Locates change sets across all flow entries in flow node's flow table. It is not a requirement for the change sets to be part of this particular flow-node's change history.

Parameters:
changeSets - The change sets that we are to search for. must be a non-null, non-empty list of change sets. Cannot contain null elements.
flowFlags - a bit mask indicating which flows to search. The value of this parameter must be valid according to FlowFlags.isValid(int).
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a non-null collection of IChangeSetFlowReport, one for each change set specified.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under either IWorkspaceConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
FlowFlags, IFlowNodeConnection.getFlowTable()

getLocksInFlows

                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
Locates repository locks across all stream flow entries in flow node's flow table.

Parameters:
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired

a non-null ILockSearchResult, indicating who is holding repository locks.
Throws:

                           throws TeamRepositoryException
Locates repository locks within a stream.

Parameters:

Returns:
a lock search result, detailing the locks for the stream. THe results may be capped to a maximum value to ensure scalability.
